update.description:
The following jobs use linuxbrew to create homebrew pull requests and update the bottle hashes.

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/

Recently, the speed of these jobs has been greatly reduced. The jobs should be very quick, but creating a pull request has changed from [4 minutes a few months ago](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/319/) to [30 minutes today](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/344/) and updating bottle hashes from [5 minutes](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/602/) to [30 minutes](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/626/).

Something has changed upstream at linuxbrew, and I believe they are requiring more packages to be installed by default, and while bottles (precompiled binaries) are available, they require brew to be installed in a specific location. This pull request updates our homebrew setup script to use the linuxbrew installer with the default location. Also, it doesn't reinstall linuxbrew every time, so it should be a bit faster.

With this pull request, the job times are now [under a minute](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/630/).
update.title: Speed up jobs using linuxbrew

content.raw: Oh great time saving. The PR changes the script to install always the latest linuxbrew version which could lead to some stability problems depending on: disruptive changes upstream or bugs released in latest versions. We can try and see how many problem we find along the way.
content.html: Oh great time saving. The PR changes the script to install always the latest linuxbrew version which could lead to some stability problems depending on: disruptive changes upstream or bugs released in latest versions. We can try and see how many problem we find along the way.
